DOC.brief_title: A Qualitative Exploration Impact Positive BRCA1/2 Mutation Status Lives Young Women
DOC.detailed_description: Background : - BRCA1/2 mutation present approximately 1 800 individual US , high frequency among population ( e.g. , Ashkenazi Jews ) - Mutations confer lifetime breast cancer risk approach 90 % , ovarian cancer risk high 60 % , less increase absolute risk select cancer ( e.g. , male breast , prostate , pancreas ) . - We successfully conduct follow-up interview woman original study know mutation less six month , glean useful longitudinal data . We propose conduct additional follow-up interview participant process make significant decision risk-management , relationship , family formation , pertinent issue time initial interview . - Additionally , previous research indicate woman undergo genetic test early young adulthood ( i.e. , prior 25th birthday ) genetic counsel support need different broad BRCA-positive population . - Research regard young mutation carrier manage accommodate risk scarce . We propose conduct two focus group woman consider and/or underwent genetic testing BRCA prior 25th birthday , attend Joining FORCES annual conference Orlando , FL June 23-25 , 2011 . - The Study Application update amendment reflect follow change : 1 ) inclusion male may enrol Family Group Interview component study & 2 ) inclusion old individual woman may wish include male old member family Family Group Interview portion study . To reflect change maximum age study participant increase 100 year age males longer list exclude study . Eligibility : - For follow-up previous study : -- Individuals process make decision relative status mutation positive time previous interview re-interviewed , order learn longitudinal experience expand data set . - For 25 & Under study : - Women age 18-24 receive positive BRCA1/2 mutation test result . - Women age 25-30 consider complete genetic testing BRCA1/2 prior 25th birthday - English-speaking - Attending 2011 Joining FORCES Annual Conference . Design : - For follow-up previous study : - Individuals invite participate second telephone interview , ask describe mutation-related experience since previous interview ( approximately two year ago ) . - Questions participant specifically tailor base previous interview data . Telephone interview anticipate approximately 60 minute length . - **Note : In case individual eligible follow-up also participate multi-generational family interview ( see Amendment A ) , individual interview conduct part study take place follow-up telephone interview . - For 25 & Under Study - Individuals meet eligibility criterion invite participate either two focus group session hold FORCE conference . - Following conference , participant contact via telephone complete brief family history interview , order provide context data collect focus group . - Focus group conduct use prepared guide ( see attachment ) . - Participants enter raffle session , one participant session win $ 50 gift card . - Focus group session telephone family history interview audio record ; , transcribe analyze use modify grounded theoretical design QSR NVivo v8 software .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : Participants must biologically female Participants must reach 18th birthday pass 35th birthday Participants must able speak understand English level fluency sufficient completion record telephone interview Participants must complete genetic test BRCA1/2 receive positive test result ( i.e. , deleterious diseaserelated mutation identify ) . Participants must experience contemplating/planning couple relationship ( ) , formation family , and/or utilization risk management/reduction strategy point .
